summary: This bill, the Strengthening Tactics to Obstruct the Population of Screwworms Act (STOP Screwworms Act), mandates the Secretary of Agriculture to establish New World screwworm fly rearing facilities. These facilities will rear sterile flies for dispersal to areas at risk of infestation. The Secretary must also submit annual reports to Congress detailing the threat, efforts to combat the flies, and the effectiveness of those efforts. The bill authorizes $300 million in appropriations for this purpose.
